docs.lead_paragraph: A tentative deal between the city of Providence and its workers and retirees will prevent the city from going into bankruptcy, Mayor Angel Taveras said Wednesday.

headline.main: Rhode Island: Deal May Avert Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island: Deal May Avert Bankruptcy

docs.abstract: Mayor Angel Taveras announces tentative deal between Providence and its workers and retirees that will prevent the city from going into bankruptcy.
docs.snippet: A tentative deal between the city of Providence and its workers and retirees will prevent the city from going into bankruptcy, Mayor Angel Taveras said Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the archbishop of Milwaukee, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York authorized payments of as much as $20,000 to persuade sexually abusive priests to agree to dismissal.

headline.main: In Milwaukee Post, Cardinal Authorized Paying Abusers

docs.abstract: Documents reveal that Cardinal Timothy M Dolan of New York authorized payments of as much as $20,000 to sexually abusive priests as an incentive for them to agree to dismissal from the priesthood when he was the archbishop of Milwaukee; evidence is unearthed during the bankruptcy proceedings for the Archdiocese of Milwaukee and made public by victims’ advocates.
docs.snippet: As the archbishop of Milwaukee, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York authorized payments of as much as $20,000 to persuade sexually abusive priests to agree to dismissal.
